pullRequest.title: AF-2577: External Components Support
pullRequest.bodyText:
Support for external components in Dashbuilder With this PR we are bringing support for external components in Dashbuilder. Any kind of technology that can run in a browser can be used in dashbuilder without having to build the webapp or do Java programming. Configuration External components can be placed on a directory configured by system property dashbuilder.components.dir, the default value is /tmp/dashbuilder/components. It is also possible to completely disable components using the system property dashbuilder.components.enable. Setting it as "false" will disable external components. How does it work? We plug a view in dashbuilder that will lookup components from a standard location {base path}/dashbuilder/components/{componentId}/index.html so we have two main pieces: View: The main view is accessed using ExternalComponentPresenter and currently this presenter is directly used in a page or it is wrapped in a dashbuilder displayer when the component needs to consume data from Dashbuilder (dataset); Server: The servlet ExternalComponentServlet provide access for the filesystem where components are installed. ExternalComponentPresenter lookup for components through this servlet. Another important part is about how we do communicate with components. Right now we created Javascript objects that can be sent across the component's iframe using window.postMessage. Check ExternalComponentMessage. Later we plan to create a formal and well documented API. Finally a descriptor manifest.json will be required to register the component and provide more information. Hello World component To have a better understand of how it works let's create a very simple component: Have Business Central running; In the dir configured for components create a new directory - this directory name is the component id, so let's say it is hello; Inside hello create a file manifest.json with the following content: { "name": "Hello World", "parameters": [] } Create another file index.html with any HTML content you want:

Hello World!

Now go to Business Central, Page designer and see your component under "External Components" section: Drag it to the page and you should see your HTML being rendered. Notes: Live reload is support, so just develop your component and switch between Preview and Editor and you should see your changes; All your available components is exported with the Data Transfer tool, Runtime should support importing new components as well, but in Runtime we have a cache configured by default, so live reload is not supported there. Other components tasks on this PR: This PR actually includes the following tasks: AF-2577 | Define API for plugging External Components into Dashbuilder AF-2578 | Support External Component Parameters More components You can see some components available in this repo: https://github.com/jesuino/dashbuilder-components Other components in action can be seen in the following GIF: Thanks for review and let me know if you face any issue! Part of an ensemble: kiegroup/droolsjbpm-build-bootstrap#1419 kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions#1048
